Important Updates Regarding COVID-19

Laws and Legal Resources Related to Coronavirus

Stay up to date on the latest legal developments arising from the COVID-19 pandemic, including changes associated with employment law, evictions and foreclosures, business assistance, taxes, immigration, debts & bankruptcy, criminal proceedings, family law, and personal injury cases. We have also assembled 50-state resources on coronavirus and the law regarding topics including the following:

• Coronavirus and Unemployment Benefits

• Eviction, Mortgage, & Foreclosure Relief During COVID-19

• State Reopening Plans

• COVID-19 & Taxes

• Elections During COVID-19

• Bar Exam Modifications During COVID-19

• Court Operations During COVID-19

• Travel Restrictions During COVID-19

Tech News

Uber and Lyft Shutdown in California Averted as Judge Grants Emergency Stay

A California appeals court has temporarily blocked an order that would require Lyft and Uber to classify its drivers as employees, stopping both entities from ceasing California operations.

Secret Service Buys Location Data That Would Otherwise Need a Warrant

Law enforcement agencies including the Secret Service are reportedly purchasing cell phone location data gathered by private companies and data brokers rather than seeking warrants.

Federal Appeals Court Says Amazon is Liable for Third-Party Sellers’ Products

Third-party vendors are the source of more than half of Amazon’s e-commerce revenue, and in previous cases courts have declined to hold Amazon liable for those parties’ products.

Epic Games’ Lawsuits Fire a Shot at Apple and Google’s App Store ‘Monopolies’

The game developer is alleging that Apple and Google have engaged in anti-competitive conduct following their removal of Fortnite and its in-app payment system from app stores.

SEO News

Google: Guest Blog Post Links Have Zero Value

Revisiting an issue that has been a topic of discussion among SEOs for a number of years, Google’s John Mueller stated that there is no value associated with guest blog post links.

Should You Buy & Redirect Expired Domains?

While purchasing and redirecting the backlinks from expired domains may have been a common SEO tactic in years past, presently it is unlikely to benefit your site’s performance.

41% of Google’s First Page Contains Links to Google Products

A recent study indicates that almost half of the listings that appear on the first page of results from a Google search are comprised of products, links, and information from Google itself.

Google Makes it Easier to Find Jobs, Recipes, and Products

Searches for products, jobs, and recipes will now have Google activity cards that are designed especially for those topics, containing rich media and more specific information.

Did You Know?

The Average GMB Profile has 73 Reviews, 45 Photos, 5 Posts & a 4.08 Rating

According to analysis by Places Scout, the average GMB profile has 73 reviews, 45 photos, 5 Posts and a star rating of 4.08. Of course it is important to have a 4 or a 5 star rating, but it is also important to respond timely to reviews- they found only 19% of business owners responded to reviews. Photos translate into more visibility and consumer engagement, so add photos on a regular basis where possible. Other ways to improve your presence on GMB are to add a business description to your listing and utilize Google Posts.

Social Media News

Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg Stoked Washington’s Fears About TikTok

Zuckerberg reportedly urged the White House to view the advent of Chinese internet companies as detrimental to US business, and discussed TikTok with multiple senators.

Instagram is Adding Suggested Posts to the Main Feed

Once you reach the “You’re All Caught Up” screen in your Instagram feed, you may begin seeing “Suggested Posts” from accounts you don’t follow based on content you interact with.

Twitter Facing FTC Investigation and Possible $250 Million Fine

In a recent regulatory filing, Twitter disclosed that it is under federal scrutiny for allegedly targeting users with ads based on information they provided for account security purposes.

Facebook Begins Merging Instagram and Messenger Chats in New Update

As part of a broader plan to unify all of its messaging platforms, Facebook has started the process of allowing users to merge their chats in Instagram and Facebook Messenger.

Legal Industry News

Surveys Show Technology is the Key to Law Firm Success During COVID-19 and Beyond

Most legal professionals surveyed felt that tech was the trend most likely to affect their organizations during the next few years, with cloud technology playing a central role.

Bench Trial by Video? This Lawyer Says It Went Better Than Expected

A civil bench trial that began in person in Cook County Circuit Court before the COVID-19 pandemic recently concluded on an online video platform with relatively few complications.

Discussion on Zoom Between Plaintiff and Jurors Is Not Grounds for Mistrial, Judge Says

In Alameda County, California’s first virtual trial, a judge declined to grant a mistrial on the basis of the plaintiff having a conversation with jurors about Zoom usage during a sidebar.

Why the Federal Circuit’s PACER Ruling Is a Mixed Bag

A recent court opinion concluding that fees for users to access federal court filings should be reduced will not make the system free, but may make repayment of some user fees possible.

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews

Featured Lawyer

Homer Jordan

ATLANTA, GA

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews is a system designed for lawyers to provide valuable insight from peers and colleagues personally familiar with the lawyer’s work.

Lawyers who have received reviews will have a badge on their profile showing their Justia Lawyer Rating, a numerical representation of the reviews they have received. Our research shows that the Rating Badge is the most used search filter in the Justia Lawyer Directory.

Don’t miss out on your chance to showcase your Justia Lawyer Rating badge on your websites, blogs, and other properties!

Tip of the Month

Increase Your Exposure to Prospective Clients With Justia Ask a Lawyer

Justia Ask A Lawyer provides a platform for non-lawyers to post basic legal questions online and get free responses from attorneys. Answering questions allows you to earn points and get noticed in our legal practice area forums. In turn, point leaders appear on highlighted leaderboards across our site. Sign up to receive an email in real time when a question is submitted in your practice area and locality, allowing you to be the first to answer a question and earn more points!

JurisPro Expert Witness Directory

JurisPro provides a free directory of expert witnesses in over 10,000 areas of expertise.

Real Estate Damages Expert Witness Testimony Allowed in Home Appraisal Case

A Real Estate Damages Expert Witness was allowed to testify in a foreclosure case.

Dog Expert Witness Allowed to Testify In Case Involving Traffic Stop

A Dog Expert Witness could opine on the use of a police dog despite no law enforcement training.

Obstetrics & Gynecology (OB/GYN) Expert Witness Not Allowed Due to Lack of Data

Though qualified, plaintiff's Obstetrics & Gynecology (OB/GYN) Expert Witness could not testify due to lack of medical data.
